title: Barcelona vs Tottenham : Barcelona vs Tottenham : Kick off date , time , how to watch , live streaming and TV channel details ; All you need to know
body_text:
Before shifting their focus to the league, Tottenham is heading to Spain for the Joan Gamper Trophy, Barcelona's traditional curtain-raiser. This year's contest marks the 58th edition, with Barcelona remaining unbeaten in the annual friendly since 2012. Tottenham will be the first English team to participate in the event since Arsenal's defeat four years ago. It promises to be an exciting clash as both teams look to test their mettle before the competitive season begins.
Barcelona vs Tottenham: Kick-off date, time, venue
The match between Barcelona and Tottenham is set to kick off at 7 pm BST on Tuesday, August 8, 2023. The event will take place at the Lluis Companys Olympic Stadium in Barcelona, as the Nou Camp is currently undergoing renovations this season. Football fans can look forward to an exciting encounter at the temporary venue as the two teams clash in this highly anticipated fixture.
Barcelona vs Tottenham: Where to watch in US, UK
UK: To catch the Barcelona vs. Tottenham match live in the UK, viewers can tune in to Tottenham's video streaming service, SPURSPLAY. The service offers comprehensive coverage of the game at a cost of £45 for an annual subscription. Season-ticket holders and One Hotspur Members can avail of a discounted rate of £35, making it a great option for passionate Spurs fans.
US: Football enthusiasts in the US can stream the match live on ESPN+. However, it's essential to note that the game will not be broadcasted on TV in the United States.
Barcelona vs Tottenham: Team news
Barcelona and Tottenham are facing some team news ahead of their upcoming clash. Ilkay Gundogan and Andreas Christensen both suffered first-half injuries during pre-season against Real Madrid and might not be risked for this match, considering the new campaign has just begun. Ousmane Dembele will also miss the game as his move to PSG nears completion, but Robert Lewandowski is expected to lead the line for Barcelona.
On the other hand, Tottenham is likely to make changes to their lineup, having fielded a strong side against Shakhtar on Sunday. Players like Harry Kane, James Maddison, and Cristian Romero might be rested, providing an opportunity for others to step up. Richarlison, who missed the previous game due to a knock, is set to be involved, while Manor Solomon and Yves Bissouma could be among the players given a chance to impress in this exciting encounter.
FAQs:
Q1:What is Tottenham in Football?
Tottenham Hotspur, commonly known as Tottenham or Spurs, is a professional football club based in London, England. The club was founded in 1882 and is one of the founding members of the English Football League (EFL). Tottenham competes in the top tier of English football, the Premier League, and has a rich history and a large fan base.
Q2:Which club is leading in soccer championships?
Real Madrid is the club leading in soccer championships with 75 trophies. They have won a record 35 La Liga titles, 14 Copa del Rey titles, 13 European Cups/UEFA Champions League titles, 3 UEFA Cups/UEFA Europa League titles, 2 UEFA Cups Winners' Cups, 1 UEFA Super Cup, 1 Intercontinental Cup, and 1 FIFA Club World Cup.
